quotes.description: Life is very interesting… in the end, some of your greatest pains, become your greatest strengths
I think if you live in a black-and-white world, you’re gonna suffer a lot. I used to be like that. But I don’t believe that anymore.
I don’t believe in happy endings, but I do believe in happy travels, because ultimately, you die at a very young age, or you live long enough to watch your friends die. It’s a mean thing, life.
Be nice to people on the way up, because you may meet them on the way down.
It’s never too late – never too late to start over, never too late to be happy.
You’re only human. You live once and life is wonderful, so eat the damned red velvet cupcake.
Sometimes you can have the smallest role in the smallest production and still have a big impact.

I don’t say: ‘can’t do that’, ‘won’t do that’. I’ve never thought in that way about work. The genuine truth, and I do think about this a lot, is that I’m one of the least competitive people you’ll ever meet. Except with myself.
Never worry about bad press: All that matters is if they spell your name right.
Respect your efforts, respect yourself. Self-respect leads to self-discipline. When you have both firmly under your belt, that’s real power.
